10-inches of hard crust Italian bread stuffed with ham, capicolla, salami, mortadella (hold the pepperoni), provolone, hot peppers, lettuce, tomato, onion and Italian dressing. Heaven. Great deal at only $7.95! Waaay to much sandwich for one person for lunch. 

They have a lovely pastry case filled with Italian cookies, cannoli shells (and cannoli, but I prefer to make my own filling - viva Sambuca and chocolate chips!) and sfogliatelle. 

Aisles and aisles of canned, jarred, boxed and bagged Italian pantry essentials (and they're not covered in dust like some other places). 

Keep an eye on the prices. Some are fair - Polly-O brand is hard to come by in the Valley but others are practical extortion! ($20 for Illy espresso!!?)

Is this the best Italian Deli / Bakery that I've ever been to? No. Is this the best one in the Valley area? Absofrigginlutely!!! 

This is the ONLY place that I know of in this metro area that you can select from eight varieties/brands of San Marzano Tomatoes. If you have to ask why that is significant enough to merit 5 stars... then I can only imagine that you haven't spent decades attempting to perfect your Pomodoro or Pizza Sauce. 

Combine this with the fact that they almost always have Rainbow cookies available and some of the best fresh Italian breads, and you have achieved two-thirds of an almost idyllic Italian meal. 

Before you leave the store, make sure you take a leisurely stroll along the back wall. This is what I like to consider a little piece of heaven on earth. Every imaginable cheese / meat you've ever heard uttered by the Mario's, Lydia's, and Giada's of this world can be found in the case that runs the entire length of the store. Want to create an out of this world antipasto selection for your next get together? Seriously if you can't find it in that case, you are trying to live up to Captain Jack Harkness standards, and although I adore him... he is a work of fiction! 

And I have to agree with Nathan; they make one hell of a sandwich, but I've never sampled any of their other eat in/take out items, so my input is limited on that side of the house. 

This is not a "pretty" place. It's not trendy or new and it is located in yet another strip mall. But it is a fully functional, family run, local business that is operated by two of the nicest guys you would ever want to meet. As far as quality and friendliness goes, this place rocks! I discovered Romanelli's about 25 years ago (remember... it's not polite to ask a girl's age) and let's just say, they had me at ciao. : )
Wow! The deli is amazing.  Plus you can shop for some great Italian groceries.  Highly recommend this place for lunch or dinner

Oh my gosh these sandwiches are out of this world delicious.  I'm ashamed that it took me so long to try this place.  It's not just the sandwiches that are good but the salads and desserts, too!  Everything, is delicious.  You can tell this place is the real deal because they make food like the love doing it.  My favorite sandwich is the proscuitto, yum!

I was going to give them another visit before reviewing but eh.. I got time. 

The place is amazing if you are looking for grocery's, meats, cookies etc. It is an organized clutter of it all. 

We went for lunch, which was good, confusing, and a bit $ for what I got. . The meats, cheeses and bread were all good but not OMG good. They seemed a bit lacking in substance believe it or not. LOL 

I liked it, but I have not been back yet. HMM 

I will try again!

are you joking? Where else can you get the best salami, ham, any cold cuts anywhere? I just moved here 6 months ago and have been searching for a place like this. Their meats are fantastic. I discovered this place after driving by it so many times. thought I'd take a chance. Location is awful. but worth the trip.
Best pastrami sandwich in town by far!! Also lots of groceries to take home with you. Great people great place!

The subs are huge!  2 adults can split them.  Roast beef sub with everything and Italian sub loaded were particularly good.  Add on a pound of butter cookies, pasta salad and poolside lunch was complete.  Staff behind the deli counter were super nice and efficient!

Everything was very good did the catering order with sandwiches and salads I would definitely recommend them you definitely get what you pay for.  This is far above your standard sandwich plate quality.

This is my favorite place to buy the most delicious Italian pastries. You have to try the homemade cookies. When im in the phoenix arra I always stop by  because it is just delicious. Everytime i go im never dissapointed. They import alot from Italia, so stock up on olive oil and other ingridients to cook at home a homemade Italian diner.

This place has one whole aisle for canned tomatoes & a half aisle for peppers of all sorts
Awesome deli. 
I purchased dry pastas, buffalo mozz., lg stuffed shells, meatballs canned San Marzano tomatoes (makes ALL the difference) & Tirimasu & eclair

Definitely the best Italian market in Phoenix! They have anything you'd want from italian themed non-food items to an amazing selection of pastas, sauces, meats, cheeses, pastries, and breads.  I was craving some good italian food and this place did not dissapoint.  Amazing selection and very nice people.

We stopped for lunch. Service was quick and friendly. Food was fairly good but nothing I'm rushing back for and, honestly, if I was in the area, I'd probably try somewhere different. 

I got eggplant and spaghetti. It needed more flavor but overall good. My husband got a sub but I honestly don't know which one. It's really hard to find a good sandwich in the PHX area. 

Fairly clean. Nothing fancy. Neighborhood is sketchy.

Ahh, this place is refreshing.  Smells like italy as soon as you walk in.. (ok, never been, but that's how it better smell).  We had lunch there, a chicago style italian beef and it was fantasic.  It's also a market, so, needless to say, I enjoy grabbing a quick bite in places that are a bit unconventional.. and, as I sat there eating, I looked at some italian antacids that kind of looked like screws or something that were bottled on the shelf next to me.. :/  Anyway, I also bought premade cannoli shells, which were a bit pricey, but to make my own it would have probably cost more..  AND they had the filling to purchase as well..  This was pretty neat to me.  Really though, this place has anything and everything you would need to make any italian dish, and the services was exceptional..
Great little Italian deli. Famiky owned.  Great people who work there.  Awesome sandwichs, pasta salad,  meats, desserts.  Can't go wrong with this place!

Romanelli's is great. I've been going there for the last five years and it's never let me down. I always go with the Italian Stallion with fresh mozzarella and peppers. It's a family owned business and the service is great. Rob, the owner, always remembers my order. For anyone looking for a real Italian deli in Phoenix, Romanelli's is your place.

Been going here for the Italian sausage for over ten years, very good product. However, I am so tired of the owner and his smug son. The deli sandwich prices are way too expensive now. Th ey also don't have the good crispy bread they use to have. How can panera have better bread than an Italian place? I was there last week and noticed some ordered pretty bake pizzas, so I bought a couple and they were pretty bad. Their  warm lunches are good, however way too expensive. If ya need sausage foe the bbq I would go, if you want lunch take a pass.

THANK GOD there is a HIGH quality Italian deli nearby the house...Turns out that this deli is THE go to Italian deli in Phoenix, lucky me...Looking for hard to find Italian items, they are here, looking for amazing Tiramisu or Cannolis, they are here, looking for whole wheat Gnocchi, here....They have a great website that offers what product lines they carry, BIG help....and they have an awesome deli counter with WONDERFUL sandwiches and sides....LOVE THIS PLACE!

I can't count the number of people I have told about Romanelli's, and they end up coming regularly from all parts of the Valley.  I live relatively close, and have been going to for over 30 years, since I moved from NYC.  Genuine NY-style Italian deli/suprette,  Friendly, enthusiastic employees provide great service, and their selection of cold cuts, cheeses, Italian groceries, breads, cookies and cakes can't be beat. From specialty subs like the "Italian Stallion" or "Robert's Special", hot meatball or chicken parm sandwiches, to one of the best hot pastrami sandwiches in Phoenix, this is the place to take your appetite!

Hit this place up for a quick lunch.  I took my order to go.  The place was clean and bright.  It had a great small business deli/market feel.  Everyone was friendly.

I ordered the 10" sub sandwich on white bread.  The bread was great, soft but substantial with great flavor.  The meats were quality and the provolone had great bite.  Seems hard to find a good flavorful provolone anymore, theirs was great and a nice thick slice.  They added a good balance of oil/vinegar, tomato, red onion, lettuce and oregano.  Great sandwich!

I couldn't get out if there without ordering a canoli.  I ordered the regular.  At $2.99, they aren't cheap but worth it.  The filling is made with a hefty dose of vanilla, which I love.  Just the right amount of chocolate chips.  The shell was crispy but not too thick and I could really taste the cinnamon.  

All in all, like the previous reviewer...."this place is legit".

I will be back for sure!
Excellent sandwiches roast beef and cheese was real delicious bread rolls were perfect only minus was too much oil and vinegar made  bottom of bread soggy

The hubs and I would visit Mona Lisa Italian deli in San Diego's little Italy all the time when I lived across the street. We have not been able to find a sub if it's equal but Romanelli's gets pretty damn close. I'm pretty plain Jane as far as turkey and cheese but the dressing and the bread are key (and they have boars so the cold cuts are top notch) and neither disappointed. Picked up a jar our their own brand of marinara and very excited to try it. Will be back soon!
Romanelli's baked a delicious Tiramisu cake for my sister's bridal shower.  It was beautiful and lined with lady fingers to cover sides. It was light with right balance of flavors.  THANK YOU!
Absolutely rude! I don't care how the food taste when there's disrespectful employees it leaves a bad taste in your mouth and it really makes you regret spending your money there...
Had exactly what I needed (Polly o mozzarella) Lots of it and then some... We also picked up some sandwiches and a pizza the sauce is amazing! They even have the little ones a cookie

Romanelli's is by far the best Italian spot I've found. Their food is amazing and fresh while their selection in the grocery aisle can't be beat. The employees lend to a genuine family feel, and are always so happy to see you. And the dessert case -- mmm mm mmm.. doesn't get much better than that!
My only complaint would be their limited hours, but that's just because I wan't Romanelli's at all times of the day and night.

I've recommended Romanelli's to every person I possibly can. 10/10 would eat again... and again (and again)

5 stars to Rob and his family! What do I usually get here?  My wife gets the lasagna,  I get a nice hero, maybe chicken cutlet,  or a nice prosciutto and provolonewoth peppers.  Come for St Joseph's day and the whole week you can get the best stuffed zeppoles!!! FORGETTABOUDIT!  The pastries are the bomb. And the family and staff are the best. You can get cooking utensils, small kitchenware you won't find anywhere else,  italoan tshirts, frozen stuff to take home, hard to find canned goods....everything Italian.

We were in Phoenix for Nationals and decided to come in to grab some lunch.  This popped up on yelp and it was close to the hotel.  It's an old school Italian Deli!!  We ordered ham/cheese sandwich and salami/cheese.  The bread was so soft and delicious.  The sandwich was made with just the right amount of lettuce, Onion and Italian dressing.  We were very satisfied with our meal would come back.  This beats Subway any day.
Best thing going in the Cortez Park area! It's clean, the people are kind, the food is delicious, and they have Gino's East pizza in the frozen food section!

Someone wrote that Romanelli's has a c/c service charge. Nearly every time I go there (2 x a year because I live to far away), I always pay with a c/c. Never once have I seen an additional charge (though, as a small business, I wouldn't blame them, if they did). Now, on to my 5/9/15 visit. Indeed, things have seemed to go down hill some. The owner was there and was his usual self (business like, but courteous). But, the deli counter staff didn't seem as outgoing as my last visit, though not with the rudeness that another poster said. I ordered a 10" (no where on the menu is a 14" sub as mentioned by another poster) Mortedealla and Provolone sub, with everything on it (I had to repeat that 3x) to go (very good, but it could have used more vinaigrette/dressing). Also, I ordered 12 slices of Proscuitto di Parma (got 12 1/2 slices, smashed together, still very tasty though), A mild whole piece of Sopasada (got a Hot one instead), 4 Eclairs and a Chocolate Cannoli (both are to die for). Also, got the store bought Stella Dora Swiss Fudge Cookies and La Florentine Torrone candies (both as good as always).

Oh my, Yelp worked again, my wife And I stopped in and first saw the wonderful looking canoli's and cookies at the front counter so we decided to split a 10" sub George's special sub actually, so we could get a dessert.  The sub had so much meat and I'm talking best quality tasty meat that we didn't need any dessert, but we did manage to force down a piece of tiramisu mmmmmmm!!!!! Great choice---- I'll be back!!
I would rank the Robert's Special sandwich in the top 5 best sandwiches I've ever had.  This is a gem in Phoenix.

The food here is delicious. I haven't really found that great of a deli around here yet but me and a coworker have come here and thus far have been impressed. Their subs are tasty despite being a bit heavy on the bread side; and their chicken Parmesan is pretty good too. The service is quick and the speed at which they prepare the subs is lightning fast. The only downside is the prices, I mean they are not that cheap for their subs but if you get desert like cannoli then you're going to fork over an extra $3.00 per cannoli or $2.00 per cookie.. Oh well I will continue to come here and enjoy the food.
So lucky I live near by! We love everything from here. Lasagna, stuffed shells, sammiches, and the best cannoli and baklava.

I always go to Romanelli's when I need to buy fresh cheese. Definitely recommend this place to everyone looking for fresh food. I haven't been able to eat there but definitely will sometime, I'm sure their food is delicious.

Was only in AZ a few months, already missing the food, not the weather, finally had the idea to search online for Italian places, Really wanted some tri color cookies, sfogliatella, cannoli, dried salami and the sharpest hunk of provolone there is, Romanelli's came up in the search, was not too far, wanted to do some exploring of our new city that day as well, so off we went.

The place was so much more than I expected to find here. So much "stuff:" LOL, it's almost a caricature of a NY Deli it's so over the top with not just everything Italian but New York in general! Love this place! I could have spent $1000 without even trying. I wanted everything! 

Got my pastries, some bread, more pastries and cookies, some cold cuts, including my cheese and a sausage, onions, peppers hero for the road! The funnest part was the back and forth with the people and employees who all sounded like me! :-) Attitude and all! Go here, today, you'll love it!

I am absolutely satisfied with my first time visit. The place is very unique, well kept, and they make good quality sandwiches. I got the turkey breast and cheese and it was delicious. My next visit I will ask for more lettuce and extra pickles. 
They only received 4 stars because the employees were not very friendly and they seemed very preoccupied with other things. With it being my first visit I was hoping for a Hello when walking in the door since the cash register is right there and for the lady making my sandwich to see my confused look and ask if it was my first time. Regardless, I will be back because they have great quality products.

If you don't eat at Romanellis YOU ARE CRAZY.  They put out a 8-10" Sub that puts SUBWAY and other places TO SHAME with the amount and quality of ingredients they put in it.   OMG is their stuff good.  They've got a hot Italian lunch buffet (lasagna, fettucini, parmeasana, ... as well as the best grinders in town.  Their HOME MADE potato and macaroni salads are EXQUISITE.  If you are reading this, stop now!  Get in the car and get over to Romanellis!  OMG is it good.  EVERYONE I have ever TAKEN there is BLOWN AWAY by their sammies.  WTF are you waiting for, or eating at a fast food place?  Their prices might be $1 more than eating fast food but its FANTASTIC!

My husband and I love this place, it is the closest to his mothers cooking that we have found. We had the sausage lasagna and chicken Parmesan, along with an assortment of their wonderful desserts, with the warm and friendly staff we always enjoy our meals.

When I was pregnant, I came here frequently for their meatball subs. I love their Italian cookies. The grocery section and deli have everything you need to make a fabulous Italian dinner for the family.
Da bomb. I had a pastrami sandwiche and my lady had the turkey. Both excellent with the homemade bread. Couldn't pass up a napolean and some cannolis

My mom and I went in for lunch over the weekend and tried some new items. My mother had the meat balls and I tried the Cannoli. 

Bravo! Romanelli's sent my taste buds into a frenzy over the weekend! My mother makes a mean Cannoli but I had to admit Romanelli's outdid her. Also the meatballs yummo! Not quite as good as my mothers but extremely close! 

The short of it is if you like cannoli you will love Romanelli's! Do your taste buds a favor and enjoy one soon! 

FYI they offer catering as well. Ask for Robert he will take care of you. Fuggedaboudit!

On another note: Surd I, the I must be for Insane. They have the best authentic meats and cheese's. I have tried cannoli all over this city. I don't know what cannoli you have been eating, but you wont find better in this city! Check your taste buds.

Authentic, old style Italian deli. Not many left but this is the place! Will only buy my mozzarella from them where they make it fresh! Fresh baked bread, hand cured meats, desserts....can't beat Romanelli's!

Finally, remember to make a stop here at Romanellis's Italian Deli and Bakery that has been here since I was kid growing up in the area.   Total authentic deli, bakery & grocery experience.  The lady that checked me out of the store even had a thick New York Italian accent and sweet as can be.  When I placed my order for a sub (10 inch), the gentleman was so nice, you can expect customer service with a personal touch.  The sub was made with the highest quality & freshest cuts of meat and produce.  No more Jersey Mike's or Subway, etc...for me.  The bakery counter was filled with fresh made cookies, cakes, sweets, etc.  The deli counter was filled with homemade salads, dishes and deli meats and cheeses.  Will definitely make this stop more often, especially since they have so many Italian ingredients/groceries.

Today must have been a bad day.  Went in to the store and it started like every other time we have been in the store.  Looked at the shirts, looked at the baked goods, then headed to the Deli Counter.  Saw a special on the glass.  any two different items 10.99.  I was not really interested in the meatball, lasangna, or Chicken Parm, just wanted some of their Italian Sausage.  So being it was 5:30 and they we closing in a few minutes I asked if I could get two of the sausages for the price of the special?  The very nice lady behind the counter said sure no problem.  So I began to    order for my wife son and I.  Ok I will have 2 specials,  My wife would like the Chicken Parm and the Meatballs, My son even though he is only 6 wanted the meatballs and the Lasanga, no worries I ordered the Meatballs and the Lasanga, and lastly I will have two Italian sausage.  at that point the not so pleasant fat, Short, guy from behind the counter yells they have to be two different things, then turns to the lady and states cant you read, how long have you worked here?  i began to explain and he yells again this time at me, If you want two sausages they are 6.99 a piece or you c an buy the at 5.49 a pound a take them home and cook them yourself.  I stated that if I wanted to cook dinner  I would not have come in.  he then yelled if you want us to cook them you can pay for them?  this was our cue to leave.  the poor girl behind the counter said she was sorry and he began to yell at her again.  As we got in our truck the girl came out and waved as she knew us from many past visits.  The food is ok at best however my wife being Italian liked the nostalgic feel of the place.  Now because of the rude behavior of the little fat man we will not be returning,  After 15 years we will buy our Italian Sausage elsewhere.

My husband and son LOVED their sandwich, and that's saying a lot!!! I for one, couldn't stop licking the wrapper that the Lemoncello Marscopone cheesecake was sitting on. Hands down one of the best desserts I've ever had! Nice sized italian grocery store, fabulous meat and cheese selection, and the staff was so friendly. I'll be picking up that cake for Thanksgiving.

Cannoli's. People, if you even THINK you know what a good cannoli tastes like, then you are sorely mistaken. Romanelli's hands down has the best cannoli's I've ever had. 
Ridiculous! 

The people who work here are so extremely friendly. I dropped in yesterday at 10 minutes til closing and I wasn't rushed at all. I ordered 2 sandwiches, a pound of the macaroni salad and made my way to the register. 

I noticed they were all out of cannoli's but the lady behind the counter had 2 made up for me, THAT's customer service! 

If you ever find yourself over by Metro Center and want a sub or even some baked zitti or lasagna go give them a whirl!

This is the best deli I've been to in Phoenix. The customer service was great and the staff let me know their most popular subs. The food was superb and the meat was absolutely amazing.  I highly recommend this deli. Will definitely be going more often.

Went for the first time today and will definitely be going back!!! This is real authentic italian! Absolutely delicious sandwich!  The cannoli is also out of this world! This place is a diamond in the rough as its not located in the best area. Its also a mini store, selling other items. Don't expect to eat in with a super large group as there may not be enough tables but you can order to go and I also read that they cater. If you are looking for one of the best italian sandwiches, give this place a try.

Stopped by and picked up a hot pastrami 
Sandwich, cold pasta salad and a lemonade. The pastrami sandwich was great! The meat was soft and tender with good flavor. Cold pasta salad was good nothing special. Lemonade out of a regular soda machine. The place looks like a good old family owned restaurant. They have Italian merchandise all over the place.

Have been coming to Romanelli's for some time now. Have tried many items in their deli and bakery and each time it has been wonderful. Have had a few items from their hot food area, but it's not as good as the fresh made sandwiches. Their canolli's are fresh made and very yummy. The service is always great and the people are quite nice. Family owned and operated as well.
Today I had capocolla on wheat with their deli mustard. Spicy! Also had a conolli to go with it. All in all, a very good lunch.

I went here a couple of weeks ago when I was in the area shopping for a new Bento box. I picked up some subs for dinner, along with a few items I haven't had since I've moved out here from New York. 

I got the italian beef special, and the boy got some sort of italian meat masterpiece. Mine was delicious, and he seemed to really enjoy his. I also got a bag of wise potato chips since I haven't had them in FOREVER. YUM. (I also got an assortment of italian cookies, because seriously, who doesn't need some delicious rainbow cookies in their life?)

Overall, this place is awesome. The men behind the register were hilarrrrious. The woman behind the cookie counter was really helpful, but totally evil because she was steering me towards all sorts of delcious goodies that I shouldn't be eating.

I will definitely be going here again when I get a craving for some New York subs. Mmm.

By far the best Italian Beef I have ever tasted. I have lived in my Condo for 5 years and married for 4. Never knew this place existed until my Brother in Law was introduced by his GF to Romanelli's and told us but we waited for almost a year.  Shame on us. But rest assured this will be our go to sandwich place.

There was nothing about this place I didn't like. I just ate the hot NY pastrami with the spicy mustard and provolone cheese and it was amazing! The meat is so flavorful and goes perfect with the spicy mustard. We got two cannolis and an order of baklava both were very good. I'm glad I found this place! Also everyone there is super friendly!

I am originally from Brooklyn, New York and I am Italian, when I first found this place many years ago, I was so very happy-I love the owners, products, best place ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Kathy Pellegrino

Old school deli that has amazing food.  Chicken parm and lasagna are my favorites.  You cannot go wrong with either or both.  The tiramisu and cannoli's are perfect.  Great spot or Italian sausage to make at home too.

A nice selection of Italian groceries. They make a great deli sandwich with boar's head meats and fresh Italian bread. The cannoli is always good but I had a napoleon once I didn't like. The pasty and custard were too dry, not fresh. Lots of cookies and other goodies to tempt you.

Love this place. Generous portions and great service. My boyfriend and I can split a sandwich and a pickle, were stuffed. The New Yorker or meatball is the way to go, although I've never had anything I didn't like.

Love, Love this place. I've been going for years and noticed I never reviewed it. You can't go wrong with the sandwiches they are divine. My favorite is the George's Special - cured Italian meats and peppers. I always get the hard crust bread which is great with the oil dressing, bread gets soft not soggy. I've had several of their sandwiches and they are all amazing. The meatball sub is out of this world. I do wish they had a better selection of cold salads, but eh they are still better than anything you would get at a traditional grocery store. The napoleons are also amazing. Lots of custard.

Gruff italian deli/bakery/market/bodega extraordinaire. Had heard of it's reputation via Yelp and swung in when I passed it on Dunlap. To be honest, I just went for the cannoli. Staff suggested the baked ziti or the chicken parmesan, but they were out of both (granted, it was ten minutes til close). 

Deli looked well stocked and downright delicious, but my eyes were on the prize... they filled 6 cannoli as I wandered the aisles, checking out their pasta selection (actually not too impressive). I asked for a bag of ice to keep them cool as I live an hour away and the kid brought a ten-pound bag of ice, the kind you buy for your beer cooler. 

The manager said, "Did you charge her for that?" Well, I didn't actually need a BAG of ICE, I wanted the cannoli to keep cool. Offered up my credit card as a peace offering and he shook his head, kinda disgusted and shooed me out with a "just take it and go." I felt guilty, but hey, if you don't get my drift and charge me $2.00 for a bag of beverage ice then expect cash... I brought in $2 in change that I scrounged for in my car and he seemed surprised.

Cannoli were good, authentic, but the shell was a little thick for my taste. If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll stop by again, perhaps hit up the deli. Word of advice: spell out what you want and maybe you'll get it, maybe you won't. And maybe you'll have to pay extra :)

Went in to buy a Panettone bread. Smells amazing, I'd like to try some food next time I go in. Someone was leaving with tray after tray for some huge party - Wish I had been invited! :)  They sell cannoli shells and now I'm thinking I should try making my own soon

Used to love Romanelli's for their old world authenticity.  I wish they could merge the worlds a bit more and update their check out system.  If you pay by credit card they charge $1.50 on top of their pretty pricey items.  For a sandwich, drink and bag of chips to be $15.00 out the door - way too much.  The deli sandwich maker consistently forgets to put items on my subs.  I have to check two or three times to make sure every item I ask for gets on there.  This makes my sandwhich wrapping a mess!!!  I love their no frill Tuna Salad yet they don't always have it, you have to call ahead and make sure they are serving it that day, which makes spontaneous stopping by too premeditated for me.  Not a lot of great Delis in the North Vally area, i wish this one could have stayed as good as it has been for such a long time :(

Their meatball sub on their bread is a bite of heaven. I never have room for their cannoli's but I always take a few home.  they are amazing.   Take the time to wonder around the grocery. It is worth the time.
I used to like this place until I ordered an eggplant parm sandwich....never go back. The eggplant parm was thin dry and burnt and should have never been served.

12/19

Delightful folks!  I wanted something special for Christmas Eve and with the help of Beth, I will have my special treat in time, in Prescott Valley.  When I go down to Phoenix, I'll be stopping in to Romanelli's, to do some shopping and say Hello.  I am so pleased!!
Merry Christmas Romanelli's!!!!  PJS

Want the best pastrami sandwich of a life time?!? Want garlic bread that could be the main course!!!?? Want a HUGE variety of sandwiches and pastas and cheeses and olives and desserts to choose from?!?! Romanelli's is the best!!!

Any sandwich that I have had is fresh. I have been coming here for over 9 years. Besides food they are a small mom and pop grocery store, that carries imported items from Italy and some Greek food too. Best Italian place in phx
This place is addictive,The best Romano an fresh parmesan ever,gotta try the pachetto sub.
Omg.   The subs here are money.   I love this place   We stumbled upon it one afternoon and it's now one of our favorites

OMG! Went here for our annual Christmas purchase of obscene quantities of Italian cookies. Decided to have lunch while there with the family. 3 had the lasagne, one had italian beef sandwich and the other a cold cut sandwich. All of these were amazing! The folks that work there are the best. I really cannot say enough about the place. This is a cooks paradise with a wide ranging assortment of ingredients for the discriminating cook. They also have the real Spumoni!! Hard to find!  Go here. You will love it!

This place beyond rocks! I came in Saturday morning looking to got some things to make Italian Muffalalettas  for a Sunday tailgate. Robert Romanelli put everything together for me in about 25 minutes!!! Fresh bread, freshly sliced meats and cheeses, and he even recommended sides I even left with mini cannoli and Italian cookies. One of the best gourmet store shopping experiences I have ever had. I will definitely come back.

Very good Italian Sub. They didn't get 5 stars from me because the meatball sub had the blandist sauce I've ever tasted. it for that reason lacks any flavor. I added some salt so I could eat it since it cost $9.00 but I would  not order it again. Their desserts are really good. my favorites are the Cheesecake and the Rainbow Cookies.  We pick some up on weekends as a nice little treat.

This place has awesome Italian butter cookies per the pound- I have not been able to find these in years, especially since moving to AZ. Love this place for that item alone. 

I think the food is so so, really nothing to be desired, BUT the cookies keep me coming back!

I just ADORE this deli!  I always go on Saturdays  (because they are closed on Sundays)

I forgot the lady's name up front. .. she is married into the family. .. anyway,  she's just a doll and so lovely to be around! Its like she's that favorite aunt of yours that always sneaks you cookies and a sip of wine.  

Their meats and so so fresh and delightfully amazing! The pork, veal and beef meatballs are heavenly!  Best Italian deli around, I assure you!
Fabulous sandwiches! We had 6 different types of sandwiches and they were ALL delicious! And the cannoli was the best I've had since we were in Italy!! Yum!

Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! I'm a NYC Italian and I was really missing real authentic Italian food. I really thought I could not find any authentic Italian anything anywhere in Arizona and I was really disappointed. Then I heard about this lovely place. They make REAL meatballs and REAL sauce. Buy the jarred sauce and buy the meatballs. You won't be disappointed.  The sauce tastes like my grandma's sauce, and that's saying a lot. The cannolis are also excellent. They use the REAL ricotta cheese that you can only find back east - Polly-O brand Ricotta Cheese. I asked the owner about it and she said they have the cheese special-ordered and shipped out so they can make the cannolis right. And I'm SO glad they do! This store has a lot of specialty Italian items that you can't find anywhere else, except maybe in Italy. 

You can also order from the deli area and they have a great selection of hot and cold items and some table and chairs where you can get a quick bite. The sandwiches are as close to NY style as I could find.

Instead of going to Italian Fest in Scottsdale we are having our own at home on Sunday with the family. Got lots of cheese (incl a nice round of smoked provolone)and sausage and prosciutto, a large bucket of frozen Italian beef, rolls and bread, jardiniere etc. I also stocked up on san marzano tomatoes, got two sandwiches, olives and mozz n tomato salad from the deli...delicious. Don't forget the cannolis! very helpful employees...fun place!

Right from the first few seconds I opened the door to Romanelli's, I felt like I was in a fairy dreamland.  I was immediately greeted by a beautiful display case of Italian cookies, which we (my husband and I) later went back and bought a pound of.  Then we followed our noses to the deli counter, where they had both hot food already prepared, as well as a menu of deli sandwiches. We decided to shop around a little bit first, since I wanted to buy a few items. We took our time wandering around the store, and after about 10 minutes on of the owners, Robert, came over to us to make sure we were okay. He then proceeded to take us around the store pointing out all the best ingredients and what I was looking for.  It was a delight! I stocked up on the basics like EVOO, balsamic vinegar, pasta, and bought my first can of San Marzanos. It was after the canned tomato aisle that my heart stopped. I literally turned around and almost peed my pants. I almost pee my pants just thinking about it. I spotted the pastry case, and contained within was a HUGE eclair that made my heart do a little flutter. So of course I HAD to get an eclair....and a cannoli and baklava. This was my first cannoli and will most definitely not be my last. YUM!!!!!!!

We then went back to the deli counter and ordered lunch. I had the Italian Stallion and my husband had the sausage and pepper sub. He was so impressed, that we ordered 2 links of sausage to take home with us! 

Overall, this being my first time in an Italian deli and grocery, it was more of an experience than anything. The people were so friendly and helpful to the blonde girl from Phoenix. I clearly didn't know what I was doing but they have so much passion for their food and what they do, that they took the time to help educate me on Italian cooking and all the pleasure it brings. Even though it takes about 20 minutes to get here from my house, I will definitely be going back.

If I were Italian I think I would come here every day.  Better yet I'd pitch a tent right in the middle of the store and live here.  What an amazing italian grocery/ deli/ bakery this place is for Phoenix.

I was hoping to come here just to try a sandwich and had to leave with a few other items.  I bought an antipasta salad for later and upon checking out there was this little old lady behind a dessert counter with chocolate cannoli's staring right at me.  Of course I couldn't resist!

The location isn't in the nicest area, but it's definitely worth hopping off I-17 to enjoy some Italian scenery and food.  The staff took me back to the time when I was in NYC walking in Little Italy during the San Gennaro festival.   That's culture at its greatest, but this was somewhat similar in many ways.

This is a mixed review.  We drove about an hour to get some St. Joseph day pastries.  They were very good.  They had two kinds 1) with custard filling and 2) with ricotta cream filling.  We also  had lunch.  The meatball hero was amazing plus the turkey, roast beef and cheese hero was stacked high with ingredients and reminded me of being back east.  The grocery store has some amazing Italian pastas, drinks from back east and other amazing stuff to make a great Italian dinner at home.  The pastries were very good, I did not like the cake frosting on the chocolate eclair but the custard was very good not to sweet and the napoleon tasted very good as well.  The cookies I thought were a little over price @ $11.00 a pound and you only get about 6-8 cookies for that price.  I say this is a mixed review because I tried the baked ziti also and it was very very dry, tasted like it was a day old and the pasta sauce was very very acidic.  It actually made me throw up.  I originally wanted to try their pasta because I was looking to have them cater an event but after trying the very dry pasta which made me throw up I decided to use another restaurant.  The sandwiches and pasties are amazing. Customer services rocks. I would not go out of my way to go here but if I was in the neighborhood I would stop in just for the sandwiches and a yoohoo.

This is probably my favorite sandwich shop!  Everything is fresh, made to order. Sandwiches are amazing, pasta is amazing, pastries are amazing, people are amazing. Wish they were open later, I'd eat here way more often!!! 

My go to is the Italian stallion!

Just by walking into Romanelli's I knew I was going to enjoy my lunch. The fresh baked goods smells fill up the deli and it is amazing. I had the #7 Italian Stallion - DELICIOUS! The bread was baked to perfection. The meats were cut fresh from the deli display and you could tell. I would high recommend Romanelli's to anyone that is looking for an authentic italian sandwich. I can't wait to go back!
I can't wait to go back!  The food is sooooooo good. I like that this place is as authentic as you can get!  It's a hidden gem.....can't believe I never knew about it. I
I love this place live almost right next door and go there all the time for lunch i give this place five stars and its some of the best Italian food i have eaten.

The food was amazing!! Authentic New York and Italy style. Cannoli were amazing. Everything is homemade, old world recipes. Chicken Parmesan sandwhich was delicious. The New Yorker sandwhich was very good, I Sfogliatelle is better than in Florence. The owner is a very welcoming person, make sure to talk to him. The market has everything Italian you could imagine.

I came here to grab a quick dinner and some desserts. 

The coconut macaroons are amazing. My dad loved the eclair that I got him. 

We also grabbed some sandwhiches which were delicious. 

I'll be back to grab some pasta sauce and other items from the market. 

Four stars because I felt the prices were a bit exorbitant.

To start: this is not the place to go if you are looking for a Subway or Blimpie sandwich, so if that is your idea of what is "good" you won't like the experience here.  Good sandwiches (try the George's special which is the Italian Stallion referenced by others plus a couple other meats including mortadella and hot peppers) or the pastrami that they get shipped direct from New York.  They have their own off site bakery, so try some of their breads (the ciabatta is especially good) or cookies: the butter cookies are a bit hit or miss, but the rainbow cookies that they keep in the back are nearly to eastern standards.  However, the real star of the show is the sausage that they grind daily, along with the selection of certain specialty items: 30 year old balsamic, San Marzano tomatos and Mancini peppers anyone?

I have been away from NYC since 1996 and have never been here before. What a blast from the past a real Italian Deli. I had the George's hero it was outstanding. I felt I was back in the Bronx. The smell once I entered the deli was unbelievable.  They say smell is one of the strongest senses we have that bring back memories.  Not only was it a deli but a store that you can buy Real Italian products. Then to top it off the store has a bakery. Then the best was Frankie singing our favorite hits. Doesn't get any better than that.
As an Italian that moved to Phoenix, this is the closest thing to home I have and they have amazing options to make this person content. Also, nothing better than their cannolis.

I have been coming here off and on for years and usually get treated okay,  but today it was different. I go in after having a stressful day at work all morning and day to get there by 3:15pm to purchase and eat my first meal of the day to have this what I feel was a ignorant,  prejudice, hateful old  man with glasses on was making my sandwich and he kept abruptly, rudely dismissing me and what I was saying I wanted on my sandwich and I found that to be embarrassing and rude. The people standing around me were uncomfortable with the whole approach as well,  so I calmly stood there thinking to myself, I deserve better treatment than what I am receiving and I feel that I am not being treated as the loyal valued customer as I should be. So then another worker that usually is there most of the time when I have ordered my food comes walking up and so I was assured everything was going to be okay by this point after my salutation to him and he dismissed and ignored me as well in front of all the customers that were standing around me and started taking their orders as he antagonized me in the process in how his coworker was mistreating me. I took it as if he thought it was funny to play with my fuckin food.  Well now you know Romanellis that I do do not play when it comes to fair, good, and acceptable treatment to a customer that has done nothing but up sale your company with compliments and how good your food is.  The arrogance that I have been receiving lately when coming in there has made me feel uncomfortable and now my blood pressure is high because my food was not satisfied and this is why I walked out on you after seeing the condescending prick was getting negative attitudes with me when in fact now I will and now have an attitude with Romanellis and the entire environment and staff. I am already spreading the word by mouth how you guys treated me today and will never come in there again and I have let three people know already and they said they will not go in there anymore.  Learn how to treat people especially the loyal customers that has done nothing but show you loyalty and love.  I can't stand this fuckin place now.  That was and is the last button of mine to push. I will not allow anyone or an arrogant business, person, or group ever mistreat and make me feel unworthy again. No more Romanellis for me, oh I forget thats what they wanted in the first place in mistreating me. So no loss right??  What a fuckin joke.

If you want a nice sandwich this is a decent sandwich deli. The hot food on the cart out front looks disgusting. Does it really need to be in the aisle? At least let me pretend it seems fresher and hide it behind the counter. They have a lot stuff in the shelves but i never see to much go out the door. The cannoli and other pasty in the case have always satisfied but no chocolate dipped cannoli when i really wanted one. Had to do with a standard one but they always please either way. With a few dollars and an overhaul they could make some more $$. But is kinda grubby and the staff is okay.  Try to get the soda in my cup and less than 3/4 icet. Parking is terrible. Do yourself a favor get yourself a cold sub to go and skip the ambience.

Sam and his brood treat customers like they are one of the family here.  I look forward to visiting Romanelli's whenever I'm in the neighborhood. 
 This place is a gem and a real taste of authentic old school Italian.  The cannoli was the best I've ever eaten.  The homemade sausage was absolutely fantastic as well.  I couldn't be happier to have this spot nearby, since my Italian mother doesn't live close enough to cook for me anymore.

I drive past this place everyday and have never gone before today, i went for lunch and oh my goodness! Best sandwich i think i have ever had! Had the newyorker sandwich which is a double stuffed pastrami sandwich and the the robert special which was pastrami,provolone cheese,  roast beef, mayo and other things i forgot, it was $10.99 for the newyorker but they are so big i only ate half! (so half for lunch tomorrow and when you think subway sells a shit sandwich for around $8 it doesnt even compare). De falcos is a similar concept in scottsdale which is good but this place is way better. They have a full market of imported italian products and a pastry stand too selling fresh italian pastries cookies and bread. I had a homemade cannolis and italian and it was delicious not too sweet. There was a super cute Italian man handing out samples of his hand made italian sausage which they also sell there. 100% will not be just driving past anymore!

Authenticity = 5 stars
Quality & Service = 5 stars
Food = 4 stars 

Listen, their food is fantastic I just happen to be a bit of a purist when it comes to reviews on yelp.  Only the best sub sandwiches in the world get five stars, everybody else gets four if they're really great.  I suggest trying their Italian Stallion and for desert the cheesecake.  Local tip... don't skip the oil and vinegar or ghiardineria on your sandwich.
The best family owned Italian Deli. Been around over 30 years. The family are wonderful, the ambiance is amazing. Love the homemade food,bakery and everything. Everyone will love this place

I recently moved in the area and was looking for a good sub shop. This place is amazing! True authentic Italian deli. Since it was my first time there, I had asked the nice lady if she had any recommendations. I had one of specials with hot peppers and it was way better than any sub shop I have been to. I will always try to support the mom and pop shop, but with subs like these, there is no surprise they have been for over 30 years. This place will hit the spot!

This is one of my go to Italian deli's in Phoenix. They have an amazing selection of Italian groceries and their wine selection isn't bad either. The reason that you really want to come here is for the food that they make though, their lunch is amazing and they have a variety of sandwiches and hot dishes available. The chicken parm is my favorite and all of their sandwiches are also delicious. Also on your way out try one of their desserts, they can get pricey but are well worth it.

I REALLY wanted to like this place. We just moved around the corner and were so excited to try it. I ordered two of the Italian Stallion sandwiches and brought them home. The bread was inedible. It was literally rock hard in some spots. This was unbelievably disappointing. The guy making them had to realize how stale the bread was, right???? I noticed he pulled it out of an open bag just sitting there but I didn't think it would be that bad. So upsetting, we won't return

Live close to this place and have driven past it a lot. A friend and I went in after another place was closed. This place is great. They have a lot of pastas, sauces, olives, desserts, etc that you can buy. The deli has some great selections as well. We went in for lunch and we both got the four cheese lasagna! It was amazing! The sauce was delicious and the ricotta so creamy. The portion size was huge and we got garlic bread that they made (also fantastic)!

Everyone here is yelping about the deli stuff. Okay, it's a deli and bakery - I get it. BUT what you gotta come here for is San Marzano tomatoes. Not those SM-like/style tomatoes that are actually grown in USA (yes they have those too) but the real deal, grown near the base of Mt. Vesuvius. Look for the DOP stamp (its like a region-control stamp on French wines).

Oh yeah, pick up some imported pasta in shapes you've never seen or some pizza dough and fresh basil (it's in the deli case by the meats) and make your own sauce. BAM!

Don't forget the Torrone (nougat candy) or some Italian Ice/Spumoni for dessert if you aren't a big pastry fan.

Moving to the area and saw this place from the road and immediately pulled in. They love Italy and sell some ridiculous souvenirs and kitschy stuff displaying that pride with a sense of humor. Also they have some of the best selection of Italians groceries I've seen in the valley. We got subs and a cannoli and were not let down at all. This place has the small town corner store feel with the great variety and high quality products that you expect to find in big box stores. If the food and ambiance doesn't get you, the super friendly staff will. These guys know their stuff, can hold a conversation and seem to really enjoy their jobs and helping customers. Definitely worth checking out!

I'm amazed that this place is in Phoenix. It carries rare and hard to find products from Italy as well as in-house made Italian products. House sausages are insane, the deli is truly supherb. Feels like a slice of New York in the desert.
Great food, great service, great selection of italian groceries. I need to add more so yelp will make this a post but i said everything i needed to say. What's wrong with short and sweet?

I have been all over the world trying all sorts of food. Romanelli's lives up to the quality they boast about. Delicious food! Half way through the menu and I have yet to find a problem. Love the food and the small town atmosphere of the grocery store!

We walked into Romanelli's just as it was closing, but the service there was outstanding. We eyed the pastries and ordered a lobster claw, chocolate eclair, and a cannoli. The staff assured me it was no problem if I wanted to order more cannoli's, it was no trouble at all to go and make more. I declined on their offer, but appreciated the gesture! We couldn't wait to go home to eat them, so we went into the parking lot and scarfed down our delights. I bit into the lobster claw - a perfect mixture of custard and flaky buttery pastry. Check Romanelli's out, it's been there for decades, and it's no wonder why, their food is delicious!

I love Romanelli's!! The people who work there are great and the food is GREAT. What more do you want??? NOTHING. Perfect Italian deli. Buy dessert, buy sandwiches, buy sides, buy meat, buy pasta sauce. I've never been disappointed....besides when they are closed.

First time trying this place out and this won't be our last!  Best, I mean best cannolis I've ever tried. I've tried many from all over the US and I can say theirs is so good! Their hot pastrami sandwich hit the spot with crusted Italian bread. You won't be disappointed.

Neighborhood market and deli, family owned and operated, super friendly and outgoing. 

Food: I got the lasagna lunch combo, that came with garlic bread. The sauce was good in taste, but was served cold. The bakery items are delicious, butter cookies are too die for.

This review maybe a little impartial and maybe a little miss placed. Mainly because I only had one item from here. The cannolis but I will say they are amazing. They certainly made me wanna come back and try there other items.
Best meat subs. Everything is fresh and authentic I would highly recommend this place

Loved this place the first time we went several weeks ago and decided to go back yesterday for more. I very much enjoyed the grilled sub special on wheat. My friend opted for the chicken parm sub on Italian bread and after eating more than half I noticed the bread was moldy on the final 2" of the sub as he was about to take another bite. An anomaly I am sure. Needless to say we were shocked. We had ordered out and didn't have time to return the sub, unfortunately, but I think it is safe to say we won't be returning.

Just west of the I-17/Dunlap Rd exit, this place is a slice of Italy in the desert.  At least it's a slice of Little Italy.  Fresh bread and deli meats, including pastrami flown in from New York City, salads, and a wide array of Italian specialties await.  You can grab a bite or do your grocery shopping.  They have unique olive oils and balsamic vinegar, frozen and fresh pasta/sauce, and a deep selection of other Italian foods.

I stopped in for lunch.  The small dining area was pretty full of business men and women, along with some regulars, including an exceptionally sweet woman who shared with me her love of a daily Italian Beef sandwich and Mass.  Her sandwich, and fresh lobster salad on the side, looked delicious. 

I had a hot pastrami on rye with cole slaw, Boar's Head cheese, and dressing.  It was very good.  I would definitely go back --- hopefully with cooler for groceries next time -- and recommend it as a solid lunch place if you in the area.

4.5 Stars.

Meatball sandwich week?  I was craving another one today and decided to head down to Romanelli's.  It's only a few exits down the road from work and the reviews seemed pretty good!  I walked in and placed my order for a Meatball Sandwich.  (The going rate for a meatball sandwich in Phoenix is about $9.00-10.00).  Total was just under $10.00.  I paid my ticket at the register in the front of the store and then grabbed my sandwich. Here is how it was.........

Meatball Sandwich-  This was excellent!  They take a loaf of home made bread, slice it up right then and there, pile it with about 6-8 meatballs halves, top it with cheese and then pop it in the toaster oven!  The end product was great!  The bread was toasty, yet soft when you bit into it.  The meatballs had great texture and consistency, the cheese was melted perfectly, and the sauce/gravy they use is awesome!  It was a thicker sauce and was flavored perfect...not too sweet, and not bitter either. Overall, just a damn fine meatball sandwich!  Might be the best one I have had so far in Phoenix!

Overall, I was impressed!  The place is family owned and they have been open for over 40 years.  They have a deli counter as well as a whole little store with all sorts of Italian goodies (Sauces, bread, peppers, olives, cookies, etc). They have plenty of seating, too!  I will definitely be back to have another meatball sandwich and try out some of their cold subs as well.   Service was very friendly and while I was there, it seemed like lifelong, repeat customers kept coming in to grab something to eat.  Good stuff!

I lived in the shit hole apartments next door over fifteen years ago. The only reason I lived there as long as I did was romanellies. I would walk next door and get cheap good sandwiches. I have been coming back through the years but seam to forget about it every few years. Then I was driving by yesterday and stopped in.  I have a obsession with pastrami and they did not disappoint. Told the guy to make me a BADASS pastrami sandwich on rye and oh he did work. Fuggedabouit

Great true Italian deli! Everything from meats to cheeses, a fully stocked sandwich counter with both hot and cold selections and even pizza! Full Italian grocer as well and don't forget to grab a cannoli or two on your way out! I go here at least once a week now for lunch!

This deli is the best I have had in the valley.We live in Chandler and have to drive 70mi round trip so it must be and we have tried many throughout the valley but none are as good. I will suggest the Italian stallion, it is awesome and huge as well. We enjoy this deli so much we are talking about taking a trip out there next Friday for lunch.We have visited half dozen times and have had only one issue with this nice little deli. The problem was not that big of a issue but did kind of tick me off. I had bought dinner rolls and when I got home pulled them out of the sack and they where hard as a rock.So always check for freshness before you buy anything from the bakery.There was one other little issue I had here when a gal working the front checkout counter was not pleased she had to work because she was not vary friendly at all and looked totally miserable.That was the only time I have seen her and hope I never do again, the main reason they did not get five stars from me. Other that that this place absolutely rocks dudes and is most definitely worth the 70mi trip.

Maybe in the early 80's this was the coolest shnitzel in the 'hood, but now it's just plain spaghetto.

Really not impressed at all.

Tiny portions.  Mediocre quality, at best.  

Too much bread($) for not enough meat(meat).

This place is riding on its reputation, but where it got its rep, i'm not sure.

If you're a fan, then hey, more for you.  

I'm not coming back unless someone makes me an offer i can't refuse.

Sorry I just made this account even though I told the person working the deli I would leave a review the next day, it's been 3 months. Well I remember how it tasted. Amazing if you ask me. Four and a half stars if it existed. I would give five if it was a sole eatery so the atmosphere is split. Go here if you want some Italian goods and a fresh tasting sandwhich.

Mmm mmm mmm!!! So good! This is the kind of old-school, real deal, Italian deli counter that I dream about. I had the lunch combo. 1/2 sandwich and salad. I choose cappicola and provolone and sundried tomatoe salad. It was legit. I ate there for lunch today and already want to go back. The service was great. Everyone there was supper friendlyband makes you feel like family. 
Your a true gem in the valley. Thank you for doing what you do!!
I cannot believe how rude and sexist the owner and his son are.  As a female I am personally offended by this place.

On the day I went here for lunch with a colleague, I talked about how sick of the city I was during the drive over.  Then we walked into this place at a strip mall and it felt like I was transported to a small town grocery store that could have been in my rural hometown back east or even in Italy.  The family establishment vibe permeated the entire trip.  The service was very friendly.  And the food is amazing.  I could eat lunch here every day. It is very difficult to choose what to order because it all looks so good.  I had the sandwich special of the day, and it was fabulous. My colleague shared her potato salad with me and It was the best I've ever had.  I would like to go back and shop for deli meat and sausages. 

When we checked out, an older gentleman in front of us was moved to sing a song in Italian to the clerk after commenting on how the store reminded him of his youth. 
My colleague got a bunch of cookies and treats to go.  They were consumed rapidly by our office mates upon our return.

Worth the drive from Goodyear to visit this family owned business to get freshly made cannoli and Italian cookies. We chatted with the owner who has been here since 1982 and decided to stay for a pastrami sandwich. Highly recommended!

Only 3 stars cause they have done away with their lunch combosnow everything is a la carte, chasing $$, will lose customers so sad. Keep the combos, just raise the price if you must, we can all understand that.
It will be a long time before we return.

This is the real deal!!!!
Sandwiches, pasta, salads, cheeses, meats ...
You name it, this guys are superb!!!
I keep coming back for more!!
Pay them a visit, you need to indulge!!!

S. Crdenas.

Yasss!!! Love that it's a family owned and loved the atmosphere inside. Sub was great!!! I will be returning, their cookies you buy on the pound. They had cheesecake I was drooling over.  They have a large selection of food from subs to pasta and and is worth every penny. Don't let the area change your mind.
I continue to love and frequent this local, family owned business. The sandwiches are outstanding, customer service stellar and pastries amazing.
Drove from Surprise to get here.  We weren't disappointed!  Great Italian food - huge deli department.  Wonderful breads and pasteries.  Mouthwatering treats.  We'll be Back!!
